intro: Cyrtandra sarawakensis var. longipilosa, commonly known as the long-hair cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the forests of Borneo. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red and orange. The plant has hairy foliage, which is a distinguishing feature of this variety. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland and montane forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
